snippet: Fishing companies are increasingly drawn to the Southern Ocean, where the krill population is one of the least exploited.
abstract: Oceanographers and environmentalists are increasingly drawn to the Southern Ocean near the Antarctic Peninsula, to study and protect one of the world's least exploited havens for krill, critical to marine ecosystems; area's krill are now threatened by climate change, as well as a growing flood of commercial fisherman intent on harvesting them for use as animal feed and human dietary supplements.
lead_paragraph: Fishing companies are increasingly drawn to the Southern Ocean, where the krill population is one of the least exploited.

headline.seo: Tracking Antarctic Krill as More Is Harvested for Omega-3 Pills
headline.main: Team Tracks a Food Supply at the End of the World
headline.print_headline: Team Tracks a Food Supply at the End of the World
